parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (11240060) at the end. This strongly suggests electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used for identifying electoral materials.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions Florin Barbur, a candidate for the Chamber of Deputies for the REPER party, and encourages voters to vote for him (position 10 on the ballot).  This directly fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, this content is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a select few.  It targets voters in Maramureș County, Romania, based on the ad targeting data. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to persuade voters in Maramureș County to vote for Florin Barbur (REPER, position 10). The post highlights his platform points related to education reform, aiming to influence voting behavior. This clearly fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>While the post presents information about the candidate's platform, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting.  The language used is persuasive and promotional, not informative or analytical. It's not journalism.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a clearly structured campaign advertisement promoting a specific candidate and party.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>927513996021099</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific candidate (Florin Barbur), is used during the electoral campaign period (although the end date is after the election, the post was active during the campaign), has a clear electoral objective (to increase votes for Barbur), and goes beyond simple journalistic reporting. The presence of a CMF number further reinforces this conclusion.  The targeting data shows a focus on Maramureș County, indicating a localized campaign effort.  The paid nature of the Facebook post amplifies its reach and impact.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>FLORIN BARBUR</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>REPER</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Atelierul de internet SRL, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 927513996021099) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează candidatul Florin Barbur pentru Camera Deputaților din partea partidului REPER (poziția 10 pe buletinul de vot),  prin utilizarea unui limbaj persuasiv și a unor afirmații care au ca scop influențarea votului. Postarea, care a avut între 10.000 și 15.000 de impresii și o estimare a acoperirii de 100.000-500.000 de persoane, conține un cod CMF (11240060), specific materialelor electorale, și îndeamnă direct la votarea candidatului.  Cheltuielile pentru această postare s-au situat între 100 și 199 RON.  Aceste acțiuni constituie propagandă electorală după încheierea perioadei legale, încălcând prevederile legale.  Datele de contact ale Atelierul de internet SRL sunt: andrei@atelieru.ro și +40755080070, adresa: Strada Garlei nr. 176, sector 1, București.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
